headline: Jim Cramer Believes Adobe’s (ADBE) In Trouble
summary: We recently published 17 Stocks Jim Cramer Talked About. Adobe Inc (NASDAQ:ADBE) is one of the stocks that Jim Cramer talked about. Adobe Inc (NASDAQ:ADBE) is one of the largest productivity software providers in the world. Its shares are down by 43% over the past year and by 20% year-to-date. Cramer has discussed the firm […]

headline: Legal AI Training Suits And Analyst Doubts Could Be A Game Changer For Adobe (ADBE)
summary: In February 2026, Adobe faced renewed scrutiny as fresh lawsuits alleged the willful use of pirated books to train its AI models, just weeks after it announced an AI-focused enterprise content collaboration with Cognizant. At the same time, a wave of analyst downgrades questioned whether Adobe’s AI roadmap can protect its creative software franchise against emerging AI-native competitors. We’ll now examine how this growing analyst skepticism about Adobe’s AI strategy and legal risks may...

headline: Adobe Stock Drops 26% as Wall Street Questions Its Defense Against AI Competition
summary: Since the start of 2026, Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) has plunged 26% as Wall Street questions whether its creative software empire can withstand the generative AI revolution, plunging over 44% from its 52-week high as the market reprices the stock for a world where AI tools commoditize creative work that once required Adobe’s premium software suite. The ... Adobe Stock Drops 26% as Wall Street Questions Its Defense Against AI Competition

headline: Business-to-Business (B2B) Continuing Education Report 2026: A $10+ Billion Market by 2030, Driven by Rising Demand for Online Learning, AI Personalization, and Reskilling Programs - Forecast to 2035
summary: Opportunities in the B2B continuing education market include rising demand for online learning, AI-driven personalization, and reskilling programs, with growing integrations in enterprise systems. Key regions are North America and Asia-Pacific, focusing on cloud computing and AI skills training, led by companies like Microsoft and Adobe. headline: More than 50% of enterprise software could switch to AI, Mistral CEO says
summary: Software stocks have sold off on fears AI could eat into so-called software as a service, or SaaS, business models.
